prepared_by: Ramirez Structural Inc. — Jose Ramirez, PE (Simpson Strong-Tie manufacturer sheet included in structural set)
description: Simpson Strong-Wall WSWH (High Strength Wood Shearwall) manufacturer typical details sheet. Contains 10 numbered detail sections: WSWH model table, single story on concrete base connection, alternate garage front options (2 wall options), standard installation base connection, wood floor system base connection, top connection (6x and 2x framing sections), back-to-back top connection, rake wall configuration, top of wall height adjustments (shim blocks 4"-12" and 1"-4"), and trim zone / allowable holes diagrams. Includes installation notes. Red 'APPROVED' stamp present (Anthony Montez, Building Plan Check).
key_content: Simpson Strong-Wall WSWH High Strength Wood Shearwall typical details — manufacturer reference sheet
WSWH model table with panel widths, heights, and allowable load references
All WSWH panels are 3/4" thick
If wall heights not listed, order next tallest panel and trim to fit
Do not cut structural sheathing to reduce panel height
Detail 1: WSWH model selection table — shows panel nos., widths (W), heights (H)
Detail 2: Single story WSWH on concrete — anchor rod in concrete, min embedment requirements
Detail 3: Alternate WSWH garage front options — two garage wall options with header framing, SDS screw spacing plan view, 2x6 cripple framing section view
Detail 4: Standard installation base connection — anchor bolt plate to sill plate, adhesive at base plate, impact wrench 1/2" for 1" nut / 3/4" for 1-1/4" nut
Detail 5: Wood floor system base connection — Strong-Wall through floor sheathing and rim joist to foundation
Detail 6: Top connection — 1/8" min clearance between Strong-Wall top and plate, sections for 6x framing and 2x framing
Detail 7: Back-to-back top connection — dual panel configuration, SDS screw spacing
Detail 8: Rake wall — Strong-Wall in sloped/rake wall condition, trimmed to fit angle, 2x6 cripple framing section
Detail 9: Top of wall height adjustments — cripple wall, 4" to 12" shim block, 1" to 4" shim block between Strong-Wall top and plate
Detail 10: Trim zone and allowable holes — allowable small holes (face and edge drill), allowable large holes (in addition to small), trim zone locations on panel
Installation notes: verify all dimensions/conditions/elevations at project, comply with manufacturer instructions, reference Simpson Strong-Tie technical literature for complete load tables
Garage header rough opening height table with model-specific framing requirements
APPROVED: Anthony Montez — Building Plan Check
NOT SHOWN: site-specific shearwall schedule (see sheet S2.0 for project-specific marks)
NOT SHOWN: specific uplift/allowable shear values (refer to Simpson Strong-Tie SNO load tables)
NOT SHOWN: holdown schedule (project-specific — see S2.0 and S3.1)

drawing_zones.content: Detail 1: STRONG-WALL WSWH MODELS — table of model numbers with width (W) and height (H) dimensions, panel diagram showing top plate, rim joist zone, king stud, fire block, heavy hex nut and washer on anchor rod. Notes: all panels 3/4" thick, do not cut structural sheathing, order next tallest panel if height not listed
General notes about model selection: if wall heights not listed order next tallest and trim, embed tempered steel studs panels to highest hex nut location, all panels 3/4" thick
Detail 2: SINGLE STORY WSWH ON CONCRETE — cross-section of Strong-Wall panel on concrete foundation with anchor rod, min concrete embedment depth requirements
Detail 3: ALTERNATE WSWH GARAGE FRONT OPTIONS — Garage Wall Option 1 and Garage Wall Option 2 with post/connection details, garage header rough opening height table with model/framing specs
Plan View: SDS Screw Spacing — fastener pattern for garage wall options; Section View: 2x6 Cripple Framing detail

Detail 4: STANDARD INSTALLATION BASE CONNECTION — anchor bolt plate to sill plate, adhesive application, impact wrench sizes (1/2" for 1" nut, 3/4" for 1-1/4" nut), anchor/sill plate holdown connection
Detail 5: WOOD FLOOR SYSTEM BASE CONNECTION — Strong-Wall through floor sheathing/rim joist to foundation, foundation details by others
Detail 6: TOP CONNECTION — minimum 1/8" clearance at top, Section: 6x Framing and Section: 2x Framing showing top plate attachment methods
Detail 7: BACK-TO-BACK TOP CONNECTION — dual Strong-Wall panels, SDS screw spacing, top plate connection for double-panel configuration
Detail 9: TOP OF WALL HEIGHT ADJUSTMENTS — cripple wall diagram, 4" to 12" shim block and 1" to 4" shim block options between Strong-Wall top and framing
Detail 10: TRIM ZONE AND ALLOWABLE HOLES — diagrams of allowable small holes (face and edge drill), allowable large holes (in addition to small holes), and designated trim zones on panel
Detail 8: RAKE WALL — Strong-Wall in sloped/rake wall condition, panel trimmed to angle, 2x6 cripple framing section view

Notes section: installation and compliance notes — verify dimensions/conditions at project, comply with manufacturer instructions, reference Simpson technical literature for load tables, terms and conditions
Red APPROVED stamp — Anthony Montez - Building Plan Check

Title block (rotated vertical): RAMIREZ STRUCTURAL INC., Jose Ramirez PE, (562) 519-6045, jose@ramirezstructural.com, @rsi.plans, www.ramirezstructural.com, 326 FLINT AVE NEW ADU ABOVE (E) GARAGE, 326 FLINT AVE LONG BEACH CA 90814, Project No. 25-357, Date 9/19/25, Sheet WSWH2 TYPICAL DETAILS
